text: The 1999 Bridge Creek-Moore tornado was a very violent F5 tornado that hit the Bridge Creek and Moore areas of Oklahoma on the evening of May 3, 1999. It had the highest wind speed ever recorded at 301 miles per hour (484 km/h). It killed at least 36 people and injured 583 others. It caused $1 billion in damage. The tornado's strength led to the National Weather Service Weather Forecast Office in Norman issuing the first-ever tornado emergency. In 2013, Moore was again hit by an EF5 tornado, but fewer people were killed even though there was more damage. ==Notes== ==References== ==Other websites== *Doppler radar animation of the tornado *The Great Plains Tornado Outbreak of May 3–4, 1999 Category:1999 disasters Category:1999 in the United States Category:20th century in Oklahoma Category:Tornadoes in the United States Category:May 1999 events Category:1990s in weather
title: 1999 Bridge Creek–Moore tornado
